website_summaries.verdict: Many runners were in agreement when they welcomed the arrival of the New Balance Fresh Foam Boracay v3. This neutral road shoe gained a following of positive consumers who thought that it’s a reliable upgrade to the popular series. For them, the components and features felt efficient and dependable. Conversely, there were some testers who noticed some missteps in terms of construction and design.
pros: Several runners commented that their feet felt great wearing the New Balance Fresh Foam Boracay v3
Many consumers welcomed the appealing design and color schemes of this shoe
The testers generally appreciated this product’s lightweight nature
The upper unit was able to fit snugly and securely, according to a number of runners
The seamless construction of the upper gained positive feedback because it prevented skin irritation
A lot of testers were delighted to find out that the cushioning system of this shoe was responsive and comfortable
One reviewer commented that the Boracay v3 was constructed to be perfect for any running activity, even the marathon
The forefoot area was roomy enough to welcome natural toe-splay, noted several consumers
The general durability of this model was lauded by those who have tried it
they stated that its components lasted long
cons: The top section of the collar tended to rub uncomfortably against the ankle of a runner, causing some irritation
According to a consumer, the platform was a bit stiffer than the original Boracay, which affected natural movement

customer_reviews.title: I've been looking forward to trying these as an alternative to my Adidas Ultra Boost ST's which are very good but in my opinion could use a bit more ...
customer_reviews.text: Just took them out of the box so this is more of a first impression review. I've been looking forward to trying these as an alternative to my Adidas Ultra Boost ST's which are very good but in my opinion could use a bit more cushion given my weight (230lbs). I've already run ten miles today and my feet were kind of sore...but once I put these on, I feel like I could go another 3 miles...the cushion is comparable to the boost but is more subtle when walking...so basically they feel great...and definitely worth the money...
customer_reviews.author: houston-h20

customer_reviews.title: Disappointingly Narrow Fit.
customer_reviews.text: A little narrower than other 2E width New Balance running shoes I've owned. As a result, they rubbed the top of my foot at its widest point and caused bleeding on my first run. I've never had that happen with previous New Balance 2E width running shoes of the same size. Wearing a Band-Aid has stopped the rubbing from causing me pain, but they still aren't the most comfortable New Balance running shoes I've owned. I wish New Balance offered more wide-width options for underpronated / supinated road runners. The Fresh Foam is supposed to be the best option for underpronation / supination, but my 910 trail runners are actually more comfortable, even on the street.
customer_reviews.author: Josh G.

customer_reviews.title: Way too stiff
customer_reviews.text: The Boracay V3's are much stiffer underfoot than expected, so much so that I returned them. I want squish, not cinder blocks. New Balance seems to be going this direction with Fresh Foam. The Fresh Foam Zante V3's are the same - too hard, too inflexible. The Boracay's have surpisingly little cushion in the sole - I cannot imagine running five or six miles in them. I realize everyone's foot is different, so these might be someone else's favorite shoes. Not mine. I am done with New Balance after being a loyalist for years.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe if you have heel issues.
customer_reviews.text: I always aim for the Boracay as they have great heel support. Other shoes have my heels screaming after an hour or so of walking. If you're reading this and have heel issues, give these a shot as they worked for me!! Note: the Boracay line was recommended to be after visiting a New Balance store and getting a pressure analysis. I didn't just happen upon them.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are a suitable replacement for my Boracay V1's. Fit about the same. Less "mushy", stable.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great everyday shoe. Work in hospital stand most of my day and are very comfortable and feet don’t get tired.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas V.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, fits great but I am a big and ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, fits great but I am a big and tall guy (6’3” 19 stones) and I have fast and energetic strides so now the soles are getting deformed and turning softer, not supporting adequately my heels. The shoes are great but probably the sole compound is not hard enough for people with slight overweight and/or heavy/fast steps like me.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael H

customer_reviews.title: A really great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy one half-size larger, but very comfortable. I have not experienced what some reviewers have mentioned with respect to their being a bit hot, but maybe in the sun they would be (like any black shoe). I have a moderately wide foot - rear is wider than front, which I think they say is a German foot shape - and the wide fits me well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Leggett

customer_reviews.title: The Boracay V3 are great. I have been running for years on the ...
customer_reviews.text: The Boracay V3 are great. I have been running for years on the older version, but this version runs smoother and feels more stable. I wasn't sure at first because when I slipped them on in the house and was walking around they felt odd, but once I got running they are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Cordell DeMattei

customer_reviews.title: Need to find a pair to try before ordering.
customer_reviews.text: My usual athlete shoe, which is almost exclusively NB, size is 10.5 2E, and what was ordered here. They are a bit tighter than my usual 2E. Could have used a wider model, but the box had already hit the dumpster, so stuck with them. Will still use, but without the usual NB comfort.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Bagwell

customer_reviews.title: I like this version as much as the previous two
customer_reviews.text: I like this version as much as the previous two. The only thing that I can tell that is noticeably different is the fit. I have to order a half size larger and the toe box is a little narrower.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are great for running. I have had issues with pain in my feet from wearing nike frees in the past. I switched to these and have no longer had the pain.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: nice fit. not cramped in toe area
customer_reviews.text: nice fit. not cramped in toe area, nice cushioning. Not a suitable for hard core running, just everyday walk around, gym workout, use.
customer_reviews.author: G. Finlay

customer_reviews.title: Free Foam is excellent for long distance run.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Great cushion. Comfortable long distance running shoe. I recently ran a Half Marathon in Tulsa in these shoes. They handled the run comfortably with no foot fatigue, no ankle pain, and no knee pain. I ran on asphalt and concrete. Excellent long distance running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My favorite pair of running shoes in many years. Great cushioning without being "squishy" or too soft.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Offer, III

customer_reviews.title: Felt like a kid again
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for running/walking!!!! I felt like a 10 year old boy again when I put them on!!!! They are so very comfortable, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!! Thanks New Balance and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: TexThai

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Comfortable Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Had these shoes for about 3.5-4 months now, and they are a great fit for me. Honestly, one of the best fitting pair of running shoes I've ever owned. On top of that, they look pretty good for a running shoe. My issue I've had is that after about 6 weeks, the logo and exterior started to peel off on both sides of both shoes. It's not the worst thing, but it's exceptionally annoying. So, buy some super glue when you gets these kicks.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Nike to NB
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, great feel, love the fresh foam and the texture of the upper. My first pair of NB, always been a Nike guy...impressed so far!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan B.

customer_reviews.title: New Balance Will Not Disappoint !!!
customer_reviews.text: New Balance will not disappoint. Great shoe and very light to walk in. Fits great and ordered my normal size of 11EE.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M Zetak

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit as expected and are comfortable running. Not crazy about the color.
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Firmer than the V1, but much higher quality
customer_reviews.text: Smooth running shoes. After approximately 65 miles, the BoracayV3 makes for an enjoyable run. It did take a good 30 miles to break them in, but now that I'm used to them, each run is a little better than the last. That said, I've been running with an injury (piriformis and/or inflamed sciatic nerve), but the pain level isn't as intense with the V3. They do feel a tad firmer than the BoracayV1, but the quality with the V3 seems far better. I had issues with the mesh tearing on the V1, but the material on the V3 is different. It looks like New Balance got the message.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R. Connors

customer_reviews.title: Bring these back
customer_reviews.text: For me a great shoe. Wish they still made them
customer_reviews.author: David Long

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and fast but after running in them for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and fast but after running in them for a couple of months the bottoms of the soles were starting to wear out. Now after about five months and appx 250 miles the outsole towards the front/toe is worn down. Quality shoes shouldn’t wear out like that.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J SAeger

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd pair of New Balance and these are the best. Super comfortable
customer_reviews.author: hondonc

customer_reviews.title: My husband is absolutely happy. His job is physically demanding
customer_reviews.text: My husband is absolutely happy. His job is physically demanding, and this NB prevent a lot of muscle pain.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable.fit as expected. I am size 12 for dress shoes but I buy size 13 for sneakers
customer_reviews.author: Parvinder Bhatia

customer_reviews.title: NB forever!
customer_reviews.text: First time veering from Classic NB, and these do not disappoint. They look sharp and feel great after 3-4 runs
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good, but runs a little big
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe - runs a little wide and long compare to my New Balance 980s.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewed

customer_reviews.title: Swift Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoe for running on flat dirt/gravel trails. These are my first pair of New Balance shoes that I've owned. Lightweight, breathable & durable.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R.

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: Well fitting, light and fast trainer. Love it so far. Also love the low drop (4mm) and the fact that you can get it wide (2E). I need that...
customer_reviews.author: Sverre Nyhus Kvalvik

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The bottom started falling off after a few months disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.author: ALLtheDEALS

customer_reviews.title: Foamy
customer_reviews.text: I use them for walking, as I prefer biking to running. Put 168 miles on them during a recent 3-week trip to Europe and they still feel great. The colors go with anything, the fabric stretches without giving too much and the sole and support are excellent. Like all running shoes, the orthotic insert should be replaced with something decent. The laces have orange vinyl tips, which are cute. I have the EE width, which hit somewhere between EE and a normal D width, so if you have feet that are EE and tend to swell, I'd go for the 4E if you can find them.
customer_reviews.author: ribarz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe. I put a lot of miles on them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shoe. Seems to fit just a little tighter/smaller than my 1080s. Lots of cushioning, great support.
customer_reviews.author: Carissa Gralewski

customer_reviews.title: The shoes it to small.. it my size ...
customer_reviews.text: The shoes it to small..it my size but new balance sizer is smaller. I am not using the shoes 😏
customer_reviews.author: mordi shabat

customer_reviews.title: 2e width not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: Not wide enough(2e width)! Only wore them for a bit as they were not wide enough in the front portion of the shoe....Sending them back and sticking with the ASICS Men's Gel Nimbus 18, as the frontal portion is wider and I feel there is a bit more cushioning as well. These are a very light shoe.
customer_reviews.author: flames9

customer_reviews.title: Bad redesign
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing the Boracay v1s for the past two years. Loved them. They were fairly lightweight for the cushion they provided and they were cheap. They stopped making those and I had to buy the v3s. At first they were fine. But after about the third run I started to get a bruise around my ankle. The side walls were too tall and stiff. I dug my worn out v1s and my runs and my feet felt fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: It's good for jogging at slow or moderate pace
customer_reviews.text: Low drop, a little strong cushion, and low response. It's good for jogging at slow or moderate pace. Thank you for selling 2E width. The upper is very flexible like tights. There is a fairly high drop from ball to tiptoe like Hoka, I feel it unnatural. I Iike this white and black color, but I also like colorful shoes like previus boracay models.
customer_reviews.author: Hideki Morio

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam Boracay V3 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: In its fourth iteration, the boracay has pushed the limits of soft, smooth and innovative design. The boracay V3 maintains the essence of this model, providing the performance benefits and incredibly smooth fit and feel, crucial for all runners of all distances. Careful adjustments in the midsole and outsole lead to an improved heel to toe transition and ride, while a newly designed upper hugs and supports the foot in a uniquely luxurious way.
